definition: cup/(slang) (pun on 悲劇|悲剧[bei1 ju4], tragedy) so bad/terrible/bummer/fiasco/debacle
cup/trophy cup/classifier for certain containers of liquids: glass, cup
tool/device/utensil/equipment/instrument/talent/ability/to possess/to have/to provide/to furnish/to state/classifier for devices, coffins, dead bodies

sentences.english: Of course, in the end these dark moments help make the happy ending feel all the sweeter.
sentences.chinese: 當然這些“杯具”最終會成爲大團圓結局的甜點。

sentences.english: The car is not open will also happen "cup with"?
sentences.chinese: 車不開難道也會發生“杯具”嗎？

sentences.english: Nevertheless, Zhang does not think his life is a tragedy.
sentences.chinese: 雖然如此，張沒有認爲他的人生因此杯具了。

sentences.english: A sorri situation that will only get worst.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個杯具的狀況，將來的情況只會惡化。

sentences.english: Before making tea, the tea sets should be washed by boiled water in order to raise their temperature.
sentences.chinese: 泡茶前要用開水燙洗杯具，提高杯具的溫度。

sentences.english: And then the third law comes in, and that's the depressing part here.
sentences.chinese: 然後第三定律跳出來，這裏就是杯具的所在。

definition: (archaic) light, bright (variant of 冏[jiong3])/(since c. 2005) (slang) emoticon signifying embarrassment, shock, helplessness etc
(coll.) to feel sick at heart/to feel stifled/to feel crushed
to stop one's pen/to break off writing/final remarks (at the end of a book or article)
Nyima county, Tibetan: Nyi ma rdzong in Nagchu prefecture 那曲地區|那曲地区[Na4 qu3 di4 qu1], central Tibet
